    "name": "4*8^n-1.",
    "comment": [
        "The subsequence of primes begins: 3, 31, 131071, 618970019642690137449562111, .. generated by exponents n= 0, 1, 5, 29, 35, ... [Jonathan Vos Post, Oct 31 2011]",
        "In base 8, the numbers of this sequence are written 37, 377, 3777, 37777, ... and satisfy the A052148 condition. - _Michel Marcus_, Aug 23 2013"
    ],
    "link": [
        "Vincenzo Librandi, <a href=\"/A198852/b198852.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000</a>",
        "<a href=\"/index/Rec\">Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients</a>, signature (9,-8)."
    ],
    "formula": [
        "a(n) = 8*a(n-1)+7.",
        "a(n) = 9*a(n-1)-8*a(n-2) for n>1.",
        "G.f. ( 3+4*x ) / ( (8*x-1)*(x-1) ). - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 31 2011",
        "a(n) = A013731(n) - 1. - _Michel Marcus_, Aug 23 2013"
    ],
    "program": [
        "(MAGMA) [4*8^n-1: n in [0..30]];"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A052148."
    ],
